column1: Once Upon a Time (3rd Edition) - Card List

column3: And for all I know they may be dancing in the palace still.
column6: Kaj povas esti ke oni ankoraŭ dancas en la palaco nun.

column3: And the kingdom rejoiced at the end of the tyrant's reign.
column6: Kaj la reĝlando ĝojis pro la fino de la regno de la tirano.

column3: Despite his terrible crime, the king agreed to spare his life.
column6: Malgraŭ lia terura krimo, la reĝo konsentis ŝpari lian vivon.

column3: Her courage had made her rich.
She escaped that awful place and fled home.
column6: Ŝi eskapis tiun aĉan lokon kaj fuĝis hejmen.

column3: She never let her treasure out of her sight again.
column6: Ŝi neniam plu lasis sian trezoron ekster sia vido.

column3: So he told her he was the prince and they lived happily ever after.
column6: Do li diris al ŝi ke li estas la princo kaj ili vivis ĝoje porĉiame.

column3: So she revealed her true identity and they were married.
column6: Do ŝi malkaŝis sian veran identecon kaj ili geedziĝis.

column3: So the cook prepared it for the feast and it was delicious.
column6: Do la kuiristo kuiris ĝin por la festeno kaj ĝi estas tre bongusta.

column3: So the king relented and the two were married.
column6: Do la reĝo cedis kaj la du homoj geedziĝis.

column3: So the queen gave them the prize as she had promised.
column6: Do la reĝino donis al ili la premion kiel ŝi promesis.

column3: So the rightful ruler was placed on the throne once more.
column6: Do oni metis la ĝustan reganton sur la tronon denove.

column3: So they escaped their captors and fled home.
column6: Do ili eskapis siajn kaptintojn kaj fuĝis hejmen.

column3: So they returned what was stolen to its original owner.
column6: Do ili redonis tion kion oni ŝtelis al ĝia originala posedanto.

column3: The king fulfilled his side of the bargain and everyone was happy.
column6: La reĝo plenumis sian flankon de la akordo kaj ĉiu kontentis.
Oni kuracis la frenezecon de la princo.

column3: Which meant they would become king and queen in the course of time.
column6: Kaj tial ili fariĝos gereĝoj post iom da tempo.

column3: And his mother was delighted with such an unusual gift.
column6: Kaj lia patrino feliĉis pro tiel malkutima donaco.

column3: And she kept her father's advice in mind from that day onwards.
column6: Kaj ŝi sekvis la konsilon de sia patro ekde tiu tago porĉiame.

column3: And so the old woman's prophecy had been fulfilled.
column6: Kaj tial la profetaĵo de la maljunulino plenumiĝis.

column3: And the parents were reunited with their long-lost child.
column6: Kaj la gepatroj reunuiĝis kun sia delonge perdita infano.

column3: And they remained blind for the rest of their days for their wickedness and falsehood.
column6: Kaj ili restis blindaj dum la cetero de siaj vivoj pro siaj malico kaj malveremo.

column3: And when they died they passed it on to their children.
column6: Kaj kiam ili mortis ili transdonis ĝin al siaj infanoj.

column3: He lived the rest of his life as a beggar … which was perfectly just.
column6: Li vivis dum la cetero de sia vivo kiel almozulo, kio estis perfekte justa.

column3: He saw the error of his ways and lived a good life from that day forward.
column6: Li konstatis la erarojn de sia konduto kaj ekvivis bonkondute ekde tiu tago.

column3: His wound was healed but his heart remained broken forever.
column6: Lia vundo resaniĝis sed lia koro ĉiam restis rompita.

column3: It just shows that stepmothers aren't always what they seem.
column6: Tio simple montras ke bopatrinoj ne ĉiam estas tiaj kiaj ili aspektas.

column3: So he forgave her and they were married.
column6: Do li pardonis ŝin kaj ili geedziĝis.

column3: So he realized how loyal his sister had been.
column6: Do li konstatis kiel fidela estis lia fratino.

column3: So the village was restored to prosperity.
So they changed places and everything was back to normal.
column6: Do ili interŝanĝis rolojn kaj ĉio refariĝis normala.

column3: So they promised never to fight again.
column6: Do ili promesis neniam plu batali.

column3: Which proves that a heart that is brave and true will always triumph in the end.
column6: Kio pruvas ke koro kuraĝa kaj vera ĉiam venkos ja la fino.

column3: Which proves you should always be careful when choosing your companions.
column6: Kio pruvas ke oni devas ĉiam zorge elekti siajn kunulojn.

column3: And as long as she lived it could never be removed.
column6: Kaj ekde tiam dum la cetero de ŝia vivo oni neniam povis forpreni ĝin.

column3: And so the witch perished in her own cauldron.
column6: Kaj la sorĉistino pereis en sia propra kaldrono.

column3: Beaten, the foul creature was driven out of the kingdom.
column6: Venkite, la aĉa estaĵo forpeliĝis de la reĝlando.

column3: But no matter how hard they searched they were never able to find it again.
column6: Sed malgraŭ ĉia provo serĉi, ili neniam plu povis trovi ĝin.

column3: Every day he saw the result of his disobedience, and wept.
column6: Ĉiutage li vidis la rezulton de sia malobeo kaj ploris.

column3: He was freed from his enchantment and the next day they wept.
column6: Li liberiĝis de sia sorĉo kaj la sekvan tagon ili ploris.

column3: So it was transformed back into human form.
column6: Do ĝi transformiĝis al homa formo.

column3: So she knew that her visitor had been a monster all along.
column6: Do ŝi eksciis ke ŝia vizitanto estis monstro ekde la komenco.

column3: So the evil-doers were thrown down a well.
column6: Do oni ĵetis la malbonulojn en puton.

column3: So the spell was broken and they were free.
column6: Do la sorĉo ĉesis kaj ili estis liberaj.

column3: The curse was lifted as had been foretold.
column6: La malbeno finiĝis kiel oni antaŭdiris.

column3: The flames rose higher and the wicked place was destroyed.
column6: La flamoj plialtiĝis kaj la aĉa loko detruiĝis.

column3: The monster was destroyed and the city was safe once more.
column6: Oni detruis la monstron kaj la urbo denove estis sekura.

column3: They were buried in the same grave, and the kingdom mourned them.
column6: Oni enterigis ilin en la saman tombon, kaj la reĝlando funebris ilin.

column3: True love had broken the enchantment.
Which is how the kingdom got such an unusual name.
column6: Kaj pro tio la reĝlando havis tiel malkutiman nomon.

column3: With the enemy dead they could get married at last.
column6: Pro la mortinta malamiko ili finfine povis geedziĝi.

column3: The enchanted item saved them all.
The mirror cracked and all her evil was undone.
The monster was shown to have a kind heart after all.
And that is how they escaped their imprisonment.
The disobedient sister was punished at long last.
The wondrous beast went back to its forest home and they never saw it again.
The potion finally restored his memory.
And the hideous beast was transformed into a handsome prince.
And the whole city rejoiced because of that kiss.
So they were married at last and all the kingdom rejoiced.
But he kept it a secret, as he had promised.
But he scorned the princess and asked the poor servant to marry him.
But they never again took any advice from a fairy.
Despite his hideous form, she grew to love him.
Which is how a simple maid came to be queen of this land.
She wore the same jewel on the day they were married.
This strange creature saved him from a watery grave.
They proved themselves to the captain, who took them back home.
She had lost everything in the storm except her true friend.
Even though the ship was lost, he had made his fortune.
With the disease cured, the island became rich once again.
He sat on the beach and thought of the treasure he had lost.
Then she realized her love had returned from that foreign land, as he had promised.
Which is how she came to be queen of that barbaric island.
They dug up the chest, but the treasure was long gone.
They clung tightly and it carried them all the way home.
The terrible sea monster destroyed the boat, and all but one of the sailors was drowned.
But she chose to stay with the pirates.
And they swam back together to her kingdom beneath the sea.
With its treasure returned, the monster was never seen again.
The king ordered the island to be removed from all maps so no-one could ever go there again.
So he became the most feared pirate in history.
So she became the richest merchant in all the world.
Because of her skill with a lance, women were allowed to become knights from then on.
His lady love touched the relic to his lips and he was healed.
He won back his weapons and armor through his skill and cunning.
Because of her holiness, the terrible war was finally ended.
He continued to wear her symbol on his shield from that day onward.
Because of his recklessness, his betrayal was revealed.
Although she was unarmed, she defeated that mighty opponent and won back her manor.
And so the squire overcame his cowardice and saved the day.
The herald said it was the strangest joust ever seen in that land.
Her quest was completed and her castle was repaired at last.
Because the vow had been broken, the battle was lost.
He proved his love for her by winning the joust.
Her courage drove the bandits away and saved the man she loved.
The queen banished the wizard and had the tomb restored to its former glory.
The search revealed the stolen love token in his pavilion, and he was punished.
The priest's clever solution resolved the border dispute, and so their anger faded.
They finally overcame the castle's defenses, and so the long siege ended.
